title: Are Latinos the descendants of Spanish conquistadors? - Quora

response.answer_text: A great amount of them are. Ohters descend of Spanish colonizers, other of Spanish immigrants, others, a great lot, of indigenous Americans, and most of different mixes between African slaves, European immigrants, indigenous inhabitants. The result is a numerous set of racial types and cultural traits that revolve around the usage of Spanish and the Christian religion that does not have the characteristics of a race, nor of a single culture. And trying to label it simply as “Latino” is as over simplifying that could be considered stupid if it were not just an excuse to label some sector of the population as “non-white”, which for me is the only purpose behind it.

Latin Americans are the result of five centuries of racial mixing! The majority are a highly variable mixture of Spanish and/or Portuguese (or other European ancestry) and Native American or Black. Some, especially in the Caribbean and Brazil, are a mixture of all three. Not all Latinos have the same mix however and many are mostly indigenous or black with little to no European ancestry at all, while others have substantial European ancestry and a relatively small percentage are of fully European descent. White Latinos are usually the privileged, upper-class in Latin American society. Whilst the mixed Latinos tend to be less privileged (based on their racial mix) and the fully indigenous or black Latinos are usually the poorest and most oppressed of all!

Some are. Others are descendants of the colonists who came to their countries. Many have no European heritage at all, but are 100% Native American. Many are a mixture of a number of backgrounds, as is common in the New World. Some are of Asian ancestry. Others are from Africa. Some have heritage from other parts of Europe.

Some are, most aren’t. Most Latinos are a mix of Europeans, Natives and Africans depending on the country or region they come from. However, the European ancestors of most Latin Americans weren’t “conquistadors”, they were immigrants who usually arrived when the Americas had already been conquered for a long time.

“Are Latinos the descendants of Spanish conquistadors?”  No. Latino just means someone who belongs to a culture with a language descended from Latin. French, Romanians, Italians… all latinos, but not necessarily “conquistadors.” Latin Union - Wikipedia
